content: Does anyone know of a website or service that offers rentals such as houses, apartments, or rooms, with the rent paid in Bitcoin? Please share resources if you know some. I live in Sweden but work in Denmark, due to the lower sink tax and crypto tax. I have used sites like BoligPortalen, kvikbolig.dk and uthyrningsportal.se, but they are all more traditional. As Sweden is sweet on startups, maybe such a service/website is available here already? Is it even legal and how can you protect yourself and prove your transfers? Have you seen any such service or infrastructure? If it did exist, would some of you users/holders/miners consider paying for rent or even the utilities in cryptocurrency? Is bitcoin the right currency to use in such a service or are there obviously better ones? Maybe stable coins (less volatility/more open/public / ...)

You'll get your answer by yourself.Quote from: Sliderman123 on January 11, 2023, 12:35:26 PMIf it did exist, would some of you users/holders/miners consider paying for rent or even the utilities in cryptocurrency? But Im always happy to accept/pay in BTC for all the utilities if it is possible.Quote from: Sliderman123 on January 11, 2023, 12:35:26 PMIs bitcoin the right currency to use in such a service or are there obviously better ones? (less volatility/more open/public / ...)Less volatile ? You means stables ? But then again theres no point in using usdt, since its riskier than fiat usd. Bitcoin is the safest one.

Just imagine in a decade and 2 years, that other countries like El Salvador made Bitcoin a legal tender currency in their territory, and the big companies accepted Bitcoin, do you think it is not the right currency?Now to the question of anyone is doing that with a Landlord who uses Bitcoin as a mode of payment in the rental, my answer to you here is that it depends if the renter is a bitcoin enthusiast and if the tenant is also a crypto enthusiast, it can be said if it is possible to happen, but if this is the policy of the landlord of the apartment, it is possible for him to teach his tenant to have a wallet so that he can pay him with bitcoin from their bank account to the wallet apps.

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: Sliderman123 on January 11, 2023, 12:35:26 PMDoes anyone know of a website or service that offers rentals such as houses, apartments, or rooms, with the rent paid in Bitcoin? Please share resources if you know some.Is it even legal and how can you protect yourself and prove your transfers? Have you seen any such service or infrastructure? If it did exist, would some of you users/holders/miners consider paying for rent or even the utilities in cryptocurrency? Is bitcoin the right currency to use in such a service or are there obviously better ones? (less volatility/more open/public / ...)First of all, bitcoin is a currency and it has value. So if both parties are agreed on bitcoin payment, then for sure there is no issue in doing a transaction in bitcoin.In most countries, including mine, it is not legal to do transactions in bitcoin, so in my case, if i still do transactions in bitcoin and any mishap happens, in terms of house, or apartment ownership, I cannot take my case in a court of law.So you need to consider the legal aspect of this matter also as when the rent is paid in bitcoin, the government may demand taxes on rent received, and then they found that all is being done through bitcoin, so if you are not sure about things, better hire a legal person to guide you.
